data.question: What is the title of the article?
Who are the authors of the article?
data.answer: Tanya K. Ronson, Yujia Wang, Kim Baldridge, Jay S. Siegel, and Jonathan R. Nitschke

data.question: What is the DOI of the article?
What type of synthesis is discussed in the article?
data.answer: The synthesis of an S10-symmetric 5-fold interlocked [2]catenane

data.question: What method was used for X-ray crystallography data collection?
What computational methods were used in the study?
data.answer: Density Functional types including B3LYP, B3LYP-D3, and B97-D with the 6-31G(d,p) and TZVP basis sets

data.question: What is the significance of the S10 symmetry in the synthesized [2]catenane?
data.answer: The S10 symmetry indicates a specific structural symmetry within the interlocked [2]catenane, contributing to its unique chemical and physical properties.

data.question: How does the presence of corannulene influence the structure of the synthesized catenane?
data.answer: Corannulene contributes to the formation of bowl-in-bowl substructures within the catenane, affecting its overall geometry and potentially its binding properties.

data.question: Is the article focused on the development of new materials?
Does the article provide a solution for large-scale industrial synthesis?
Was the SQUEEZE function of PLATON used in the study?
Did the study involve the use of animal subjects?
Is the synthesized [2]catenane potentially useful for nanotechnology applications?
Was the study conducted at a single institution?
Does the article report on the environmental impact of the synthesis process?
What role does the GRADE program play in the study?
data.answer: The GRADE program was used to generate a full set of bond distance and angle restraints for the organic ligand arms, facilitating realistic modeling.

data.question: What was the purpose of using the SQUEEZE function of PLATON in the study?
data.answer: The SQUEEZE function was employed to remove the contribution of electron density associated with highly disordered solvent, aiding in the refinement of crystal structures.

data.question: How does the synthesis of the S10-symmetric [2]catenane contribute to the field of supramolecular chemistry?
data.answer: The synthesis demonstrates the ability to precisely control the assembly of complex molecular architectures, offering insights into the design of novel supramolecular systems.

data.question: Was the synthesis of the S10-symmetric [2]catenane achieved through a single-step process?
